speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: ACT III

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: SCENE I. A heath.

speaker: CORNWALL
text_entry: Storm still. Enter KENT and a Gentleman, meeting

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Who's there, besides foul weather?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: One minded like the weather, most unquietly.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: I know you. Where's the king?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Contending with the fretful element:

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Bids the winds blow the earth into the sea,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Or swell the curled water 'bove the main,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: That things might change or cease; tears his white hair,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Which the impetuous blasts, with eyeless rage,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Catch in their fury, and make nothing of;

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Strives in his little world of man to out-scorn

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: The to-and-fro-conflicting wind and rain.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: This night, wherein the cub-drawn bear would couch,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: The lion and the belly-pinched wolf

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Keep their fur dry, unbonneted he runs,

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: And bids what will take all.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: But who is with him?

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: None but the fool; who labours to out-jest

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: His heart-struck injuries.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Sir, I do know you;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: And dare, upon the warrant of my note,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Commend a dear thing to you. There is division,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Although as yet the face of it be cover'd

speaker: KENT
text_entry: With mutual cunning, 'twixt Albany and Cornwall;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Who have--as who have not, that their great stars

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Throned and set high?--servants, who seem no less,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Which are to France the spies and speculations

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Intelligent of our state; what hath been seen,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Either in snuffs and packings of the dukes,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Or the hard rein which both of them have borne

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Against the old kind king; or something deeper,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Whereof perchance these are but furnishings;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: But, true it is, from France there comes a power

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Into this scatter'd kingdom; who already,

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Wise in our negligence, have secret feet

speaker: KENT
text_entry: In some of our best ports, and are at point

speaker: KENT
text_entry: To show their open banner. Now to you:

speaker: KENT
text_entry: If on my credit you dare build so far

speaker: KENT
text_entry: To make your speed to Dover, you shall find

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Some that will thank you, making just report

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Of how unnatural and bemadding sorrow

speaker: KENT
text_entry: The king hath cause to plain.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: I am a gentleman of blood and breeding;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: And, from some knowledge and assurance, offer

speaker: KENT
text_entry: This office to you.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: I will talk further with you.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: No, do not.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: For confirmation that I am much more

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Than my out-wall, open this purse, and take

speaker: KENT
text_entry: What it contains. If you shall see Cordelia,--

speaker: KENT
text_entry: As fear not but you shall,--show her this ring;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: And she will tell you who your fellow is

speaker: KENT
text_entry: That yet you do not know. Fie on this storm!

speaker: KENT
text_entry: I will go seek the king.

speaker: Gentleman
text_entry: Give me your hand: have you no more to say?

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Few words, but, to effect, more than all yet;

speaker: KENT
text_entry: That, when we have found the king,--in which your pain

speaker: KENT
text_entry: That way, I'll this,--he that first lights on him

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Holla the other.

speaker: KENT
text_entry: Exeunt severally
